text:
I think being able to have two pages side by side while programming is pretty important, and with a 16x9 display, I can get 2 100x50 windows side by side, with readable text, and lots of room to spare.
100 characters also gives enough room to pick a decent *logical* place to break longer lines.
Finally, Julia is great at inlining code, you really don’t need to have code nested so many levels that you need really wide windows, you can make your code a lot easier to understand by breaking things up into smaller internal functions.
